data.text:
@DGBassani I mean, RSV and flu are going to be *in* the prior year comparative numbers, no?
🤘
@DGBassani The peak in weeks 1-3 is before the restrictions were lifted. Flu season 2018 had higher mortality

@DGBassani A resource-rich country not even doing the bare-minimum.
- Even masking is de-normalized.
- No ventilation measures.
- Healthcare in surgical/plastic mask.
- Virus considered not airborne.

LongCovid & chronic diseases don't figure into the (surrender) strategy.
Top results. https://t.co/E5ud4yquCd
@DGBassani @CBroendsholmA From my day: No RSV only 1 influenza and 2 covid in the bigges ICU in Denmark.

@DGBassani Agreed they should acknowledge excess mortality to investigate and prevent what caused it.

The misinfo page denying excess mortality signals they care more about what people think of the country/covid response than the lives of their residents.

Blue bars (RSV) and orange bars (Influenza): height corresponds to peak weekly confirmed cases (on y axis), width corresponds to duration of seasonal wave. 

Green bars (SARS-CoV-2) height corresponds to 1/10 of the peak of cases during the periods covered (~3 waves).
